ConsolidatePurchOrdersForDropShipmentsFeatureSummary=This feature makes it possible to choose whether the "Create direct delivery orders" batch job should consolidate qualifying sales orders into a single purchase order when creating a direct delivery. You can control this behaviour using the new "Consolidate sales orders for direct deliveries" setting on the "Delivery" tab of the "Procurement and sourcing parameters" page. When you enable this feature, the system defaults to not consolidating qualifying sales orders, which is different from the previous behaviour. Previously, the batch job always consolidated qualifying sales orders.

 ;This is a description of an upgrade script
CopyTotalDiscountSalesCreditNoteFeature_Label=Copy total discount group for sales credit note
 ;Label for CopyTotalDiscountSalesCreditNoteFeature feature
CopyTotalDiscountSalesCreditNoteFeature_Summary= This change will introduce the copying of the total discount group from a sales order header, when the header functions Create Credit Note is applied for a sales order and Find Sales Order is applied for a sales return order. Without this feature, the total discount group will be defaulted from the customer account, when the sales order or sales return order is created, and not automatically updated when using either of these header functions. When this feature is enabled, the total discount group is copied from the sales order related to the sales invoice used as source when applying the header function Create Credit Note or Find Sales Order. If no total discount group is found, then the total discount group defaulted from the customer account when the sales order or sales return order is created will not be updated. This change will have an impact on pricing in scenarios for sales orders of type sales order, where the calculation of total discount is set to take place upon posting. This policy is set in accounts receivables parameters for price. When the total discount calculation is set to take place upon posting, then the total discount percentage applied from the sales invoice will be recalculated based on the total discount group on the sales order of type sales order. In the case of more sales orders included in the sales invoice used as source for the function Create Credit Note, and the total discount group is different on these sales orders, then the total discount group applied will be the one related to the sales order for the invoice record selected in the Create Credit Note and Find Sales Order forms. In case where the sales order has been deleted after invoicing or no total discount group is found, then the total discount group defaulted from the customer account upon sales order or sales return order creation will not be changed.
 ;Summary for CopyTotalDiscountSalesCreditNoteFeature feature

 ;Help text for DeliveryDateCTPCalculateOnAddLines parameter on the form control.
DeliveryDateCTPRecalculateOnUpdate=Keep CTP as line delivery date control when delivery date is recalculated from header update
 ;Label for the parameter which is responsible for header 2 lines delivery date updates
DeliveryDateCTPRecalculateOnUpdateHelpTxt=When set to Yes, updates to a sales order header prompting a recalculation of line delivery dates, will not reset delivery date control to None for lines having delivery date control initially set to CTP. For such lines the recalculation of line delivery dates will not change line delivery date control from CTP to None. When set to No, the line delivery date control for these lines will change from CTP to None after the delivery date recalculation.
 ;Help text for DeliveryDateCTPRecalculateOnUpdate parameter on the form control.

DevDocBillOfMaterialsVersion=The BOMBillOfMaterialsVersionEntity data entity contains all the BOM versions. This data entity connects to the BOMBillOfMaterialsHeaderEntity data entity in order to specify the BOM to which the version refers, and it connects to the InventTable table to specify to which item the BOM version is assigned. The BOMBillOfMaterialsVersionEntity data entity also connects to the InventDim table to specify a site for the BOM version. Additionally, the BOMBillOfMaterialsVersionEntity data entity stores information about the approval and activation for each BOM version.
 ;{locked} Entity developer documentation

EcoResProductTranslationFallbackFeatureDescription=Display product names and descriptions in each user’s preferred language. For companies operating worldwide, in multiple countries/regions, it’s important to let each user work with product information in their own language. Sales representatives communicating with customers on the phone will see product names in their local language. Purchasers will be able to search for products in the language they speak. Shop floor workers will get product names and instructions in familiar terms. In each case, the information can be shown in a language other than the system language. For products where no name and/or description are available in the user's language, the system will instead show the system language.

EDT_MarkupCalcPerInvoiceForSummaryUpdate=Combine charges on combined invoices
 ;Label used for MarkupCalcPerInvoiceForSummaryUpdate EDT
EDT_MarkupCalcPerInvoiceForSummaryUpdateHelp=Controls how auto charges are calculated when multiple sales orders are combined into a single invoice using the "summary update" function. Set this to "Yes" to first calculate the grand total of all sales orders included in the combined invoice and then apply the auto charge to that total. Set this to "No" to calculate a separate auto charge for each sales order included in the combined invoice. Depending on your other auto charge settings, this could affect the total value of the charges (for example, if you are calculating based on a fixed value per charge rather than percentage of the sales order values).
 ;Label used for MarkupCalcPerInvoiceForSummaryUpdate EDT
EDT_MarkupIsCompound=Compound
 ;Label for the MarkupIsCompound EDT used on the auto charges
EDT_MarkupIsCompoundHelpText=Specifies whether to include previous header charges in the value base when calculating a header charge. This only applies to header charges calculated as a percentage of the value base. For charges where this option is enabled, all header level charges with a sequence value equal to or lower than the sequence of the compound charge are added to the sum of line and line charge amounts to establish the value base.
 ;Label for the MarkupIsCompound EDT help text used on the auto charges
EDT_MarkupPosition=Position
 ;Label for the MarkupPosition EDT used on the auto charges
EDT_MarkupPositionHelpText=Indicates the actual order in which each header charge is calculated, including in cases where you have overlapping sequence values. This value is generated by the system and can't be edited. For historical purposes, this value is included with the transactional data stored for each charge (in the MarkupTrans table).
 ;Label for the MarkupPosition EDT help text used on the auto charges
EDT_MarkupResearchPriorPosting=Re-search on posting
 ;Label used for MarkupResearchPriorPosting EDT
EDT_MarkupResearchPriorPostingHelp=Specifies whether header auto charges on sales orders and sales quotations should be re-searched when documents are confirmed or posted. Other manually added charges won't be affected during the re-search process.
 ;Label used for MarkupResearchPriorPosting EDT
EDT_MarkupSequence=Sequence
 ;Label for the MarkupChargeSequence EDT used on the auto charges
EDT_MarkupSequenceHelpText=Specifies the sequential order in which each header charge should be calculated (which is important for compound charges). Charges with lower sequence numbers are calculated first and will be added to the value base for compound charges that have an equal or higher sequence number. While it is possible to create overlapping sequence numbers, we recommend that you avoid them to prevent ambiguities.
 ;Label for the MarkupChargeSequence EDT help text used on the auto charges
EDT_MarkupSpecificUnitSymbol=Unit
 ;Label for the MarkupSpecificUnitSymbol EDT value used on the auto charges
EDT_MarkupSpecificUnitSymbolHelpText=This value only applies when "Category" is set to "Unit specific" or "Unit specific match". It specifies the unit of measure for which each charge applies. When the category is "Unit specific match", the charge only applies when the unit specified in the order is an exact match for the unit specified here. When the category is "Unit specific", the system will compare the unit specified in the order to the unit specified here; if the units match, the charge applies; if the units differ and an applicable conversion factor exists, the system will apply a matching factor to the charge; if the units differ and no applicable conversion factor exists, the charge will not be applied.
 ;Label for the MarkupSpecificUnitSymbol EDT help text value used on the auto charges

 ;Help text for the product search lookup parameter
EnablesOverrideDefaultProdReservation=This feature enables you to set a default reservation principle for each item model group, which means that you can have different reservation principles applied automatically for each item that is part of a production bill of material (BOM) or batch order formula. For each item model group, you can now choose whether that group should override the default reservation principle set for an order, and choose what that group's reservation principle should be (manual, estimation, scheduling, release, or start). When you create a new production or batch order, you are asked to select a reservation principle to apply to that order and all of its BOM or formula lines. With this new feature, some or all of the BOM or formula lines can instead override that default to match the reservation principle set for the relevant item model group.
 ; summary used for the ProdOverrideDefaultProdReservationFeature feature

 ;A label for EnableWorkerFilter field on JmgRegistrationSetup table.

EndCustomerAccountNumHelp=This setting only applies to intercompany purchase orders. Use it to specify the account number of the customer who will eventually receive the goods. When this field is set, purchase order lines will take external item descriptions and numbers from this customer account rather than from the supplier specified on the purchase order. If you change the customer account later, then external item descriptions and numbers will be updated to match the new account. External item descriptions and numbers for each line will also be synched to the matching intercompany sales order.
 ;Help text for EndCustomerAccountNum

For example, requesting a comparison of current active standard cost against next years pending standard cost for 60,000 items would yield a very long report, where data is difficult to review. Feature_EcoResProductVariantSuggestionsEnhancedFeature_Summary=This feature improves the performance and usability of the Variant suggestions page when you have a high number of dimension combinations from which to create variants. The following changes are included:\n\t- Deferred generation of variant suggestions: The Variant suggestions page no longer shows suggestions when you first open it. Instead, you must explicitly select a button to generate them. This increases user confidence by making the process more visible and interactive.\n\t- Selection of dimensions values: When you have many dimension values, you are typically interested in generating variant suggestions that include just a few of them (such as when introducing a new set of colours or styles). With the improved design, you can select the dimension values for which you want to generate product variant suggestions. This greatly increases the relevance of the suggested variants and improves both system performance and user productivity.
 ;Summary for the EcoResProductVariantSuggestionsEnhancedFeature feature

 ;Label for IntercompanyAutoCreatePurchaseOrderFeature class
IntercompanyAutoCreatePurchaseOrderFeatureSummary=This feature automates the creation of both Intercompany direct delivery sales and intercompany direct delivery purchase order when purchase order in another legal entity is created. When this feature is disabled, the creation of the intercompany direct delivery purchase order is deferred until the Intercompany direct delivery sales is opened in the sales order details page. When the feature is enabled, the intercompany direct delivery purchase order is created without having to open the Intercompany direct delivery sales order from the sales order details form.\r\n\r\nThis feature is applied for cases when 'Create Intercompany orders' and 'Direct delivery' are set to Yes on intercompany sales order.
 ;Label for IntercompanyAutoCreatePurchaseOrderFeature summary

InventAdjustmentsBasedOnReasonCodesFeatureSummary=This feature adds efficiency, speed, and clear documentation to the stock adjustment process for both warehouses and retail stores. While warehouse and retail store workers are registering on-hand stock adjustments, they can select from a targeted set of pre-defined adjustment reasons. The system can then automatically post each adjustment to the appropriate offset account based on the stated reason (such as stolen, damaged, or expired), thereby enabling the finance department to provide an accurate balance sheet.

 ;Warning for InventoryReportingCurrencyTriangulationFeature
InventoryReportingCurrencyTriangulationFeature_Summary=This feature changes the accounting practice for stock related events in regards to reporting currency in General ledger. In this feature, a selected set of scenarios are supported.\r\nHistorically stock events has been accounted in the sequence\r\nTransaction currency -> Accounting currency ->  Reporting currency\r\nBy applying this feature the sequence change so stock events are being accounted.\r\nTransaction currency -> Accounting currency\r\nTransaction currency -> Reporting currency\r\nThis is achieved by introducing a triangulation from Accounting currency to Transactions currency which is used to compute Reporting currency amount on stock events.\r\nIn addition the offset postings of accruals occurring as part of invoice will now use the original exchange rate applied and the spot rate.
 ;Label for preview feature description.

 ;Label for InventUpdateBlockedItemEntity entity
InventUpdateOnHandInventSumLogTTsTmpTableThresholdEDT_HelpText=When MRP is used on-hand updates can lead to inserts into the table used to track changes to demand (InventSumLogTTS). For large transactions where a lot of records are inserted, a temporary SQL table can be used, which can reduce the risk of blockings. For smaller transactions like single sales order line entry, the temporary SQL based inserts adds a performance overhead. This field controls the threshold for the number of records that should be inserted before the temporary table based inserts are used. If no value is specified, a hardcoded value decided by Microsoft will be used. In order to preserve the legacy behaviour of always using the temporary SQL table a negative value, like -1, can be used.
 ;help text for InventUpdateOnHandInventSumLogTTsTmpTableThreshold
InventUpdateOnHandInventSumLogTTsTmpTableThresholdEDT_Label=InventSumLogTTS temptable insert threshold
 ;Label for InventUpdateOnHandInventSumLogTTsTmpTableThreshold edt. threshold for when inventory updates should use temp table inserts

InventValueReportStorageBundle=Large Volume Historical Stock Value Report Generation
 ;Label for feature
InventValueReportStorageBundleFeatureSummary=This feature provides the capability to run a historical Stock Value Report Storage, designed to address the issue of time-out errors during the report generation process. To achieve this, the items are separated into multiple bundle lists, and the system processes each bundle list continuously. Customers can configure the number of items processed within each bundle at Stock and Warehouse Management parameters. For example, when dealing with a large item volume, such as 800K, a bundle size of 30K may be appropriate. Please note that this feature is only utilised for the generation of historical reports for significantly large item volumes, as it may result in a decrease in performance compared to the normal function.
 ;Summary for Large Volume Historical Inventory Value Report Generation feature.

 ;Invent costing

For example, without this feature, if you request the stock ending balance by item, site, and warehouse and you have 50,000 items and 300 stores, you will get a long report that is difficult to review. With the Stock value report storage feature enabled, you can sort and filter results, and export results to an external system.

JmgDecoupleMESAAndTAAFeature=Skip time adjustments when calculating actual cost per works order
 ;Label for feature
JmgDecoupleMESAndTAAFeatureDescription=Lets you choose whether calculations of actual cost per works order should include adjustments made to actual recorded work times. Adjustments are applied when a supervisor reviews and edits the recorded work times registered by each worker (for the purpose of recording time and attendance). Adjustments can reflect events such as registration errors or unpaid time off. If you choose to skip time adjustments, then you'll also be able to end works orders without waiting for supervisor approvals. You can set this option using the "Skip time adjustments" setting on the "Works order defaults" page.\nThis feature also changes the way automatic route consumption works. When this feature is enabled, route groups set to use estimated production times for calculating actual works order costs won't also include recorded times. When this feature is disabled, both recorded and estimated times are used in cost calculations, which can produce unexpected results.
 ;Description of the feature
JmgDefaultProdUnitFilterHelptext=Select a production unit to be applied as a default filter criterion for the list of jobs shown to each worker. Only jobs that are scheduled on resources grouped under the selected production unit will initially be displayed by the device. If Allow workers to set personal filters is enabled, workers will be able to edit this value, otherwise this filter will always apply when this device configuration is active.
 ;The helptext of DefaultProdUnitFilter.
JmgDefaultResourceFilterHelptext=Select a resource group to be applied as a default filter criterion for the list of jobs shown to each worker. Only jobs that are scheduled on resources grouped under the selected resource group will initially be displayed by the device. If Allow workers to set personal filters is enabled, workers will be able to edit this value, otherwise this filter will always apply when this device configuration is active.
 ;The helptext of DefaultResourceFilter.

JmgEnableSingleWorkerHelptext=Set this option to Yes if only one worker uses each job card device where this configuration is active. When this option is selected, the Lock employee option is automatically set to Yes. In addition, this option removes the requirement (and ability) for the worker to log in using a badge ID (or similar). Instead the worker signs in to Supply Chain Management using a system user account linked to a time registered worker (from the workers table) and gets logged in to the job card device as that worker at the same time.
 ;The helptext of EnableSingleWorker.
JmgEnableWorkerFilterHelptext=Set this option to Yes to allow workers to filter the jobs shown to them on the device. The worker can modify values for any of the three filter criteria: Production unit, Resource group and Resource. Only jobs that are scheduled on resources matching the selected filter criteria will be shown on the device. You can also assign default values for any or all of these criteria, and those will apply even with this option is not selected.
 ;The helptext of EnableWorkerFilter.

JmgLockEmployeeHelptext=When this option is set to No, each worker will be logged out immediately after they make a registration (such as a new job), and then the device will return to the log-in page. When this option is set to Yes, each worker will stay logged in to the job card device. However, the worker will still be able to log out manually to allow another worker to log in while the job card device remains running under the same system user account.
 ;The helptext of LockEmployee.
JmgLockScreenDevice=Allow locking the touchscreen for sanitization
 ;The description of the lock screen flag.
JmgLockScreenDeviceHelptext=Enable this option to display a button on the log-in page that will temporarily lock the touchscreen for input so the user can clean it without accidentally issuing commands. While the touchscreen is locked, it shows a countdown timer and then unlocks automatically. Use the "Screen lock duration" field to set the number of seconds the touchscreen should remain locked.

Without this feature, the system automatically checks whether materials are available for all listed works orders as soon as you open the page, which can take significant time if you have a large number of orders. When this feature is enabled, the system instead provides a toolbar button, which you can use to initiate the materials check only for selected orders and when needed.

JmgProdParametersDimSkipTimeAdjustmentsHelpText=Choose whether calculations of actual cost per works order should include adjustments made to actual recorded work times. Adjustments are applied when a supervisor reviews and edits the recorded work times registered by each worker (for the purpose of recording time and attendance). Adjustments can reflect events such as registration errors or unpaid time off. Set this option to "No" to apply adjustments to works order cost calculations. Set to "Yes" to only consider recorded start and end times. If you choose to skip time adjustments, then you'll also be able to end works orders without waiting for supervisor approvals.\r\n
 ;Help text for SkipTimeAdjustments field in JmgProdParametersDim table
JmgProdParametersDimSkipTimeAdjustmentsLabel=Skip time adjustments
 ;Label forSkipTimeAdjustments field in JmgProdParametersDim table
JmgProdParametersStampLevelChanged=Before changing the job level, you must make sure that you don't have any incomplete production jobs in your system (these are jobs that have a status of "Not started," "Stopped," or "In progress"). If you do have one or more incomplete jobs, then change the status of their related works order(s) to "Scheduled", which will remove the relevant jobs. Then, after you change the job level, you can recreate the removed jobs by rereleasing the works orders.
 ;The info message on the "Production order defaults" form when the "Job level" field is changed.

Kitting=Sales bundle
 ;Label for the Sales bundle feature
KittingFeatureSummary=The sales bundle feature provides a framework to group individually separate but related items into a sales bundle. A sales bundle is a group if items that are priced, sold, and shipped together. It lets you offer and sell static sales bundles or to configure dynamic sales bundles upon order entry. Sales pricing can be done from the top down on the sales bundle level (parent level) and then allocated to the individual items in the sales bundle, or calculated from the bottom up. It is possible to control whether or not to allow for partial sales bundle shipping.
 ;Label for the summary of Sales bundle feature.

MarkupPeriodChargeRuleLineType=Type
 ;Label for MarkupPeriodChargeRuleType enum
MarkupPeriodChargeRuleLineTypeHelpText=The type of period charge rule line that this is. Select "Monetary threshold" to create a rule line that calculates the monetary value of qualifying charges, establishes minimum monetary thresholds for each charge type, and generates a free text invoice line that charges the shortfall for customers who don't meet the thresholds during the period. Select "Quantity threshold" to create a rule line that calculates the total purchased quantity of qualifying items, establishes a minimum quantity threshold, and generates a free text invoice line with a fixed charge for customers who don't meet the threshold during the period. Select "Quantity threshold minimum amount" to create a rule line that includes both quantity and monetary thresholds.  
 ;HelpText for MarkupPeriodChargeRuleType Enum

MustUseLatestPossibleSupplyFirstHelpText=This setting only has an effect when 'Consume on-hand stock' is set to 'After all other supply'. It lets you choose whether or not to peg demand to on-hand before pegging to supply that can't meet the requested demand date (but will still meet the negative days limit). The system will always peg demand to supply that meets the demand date before it pegs to supply that can't meet it. When shelf life is enabled, pegging is done using FEFO principle regardless of this setting.\r\n\r\nWhen this is set to 'Yes', the pegging order is: (1) Existing supply that can meet the demand date > (2) On-hand > (3) Existing supply that can't meet the demand date (but will still meet the negative days limit) > (4) New supply. \r\n\r\nWhen this is set to 'No', the pegging order is: (1) Existing supply that can meet the demand date > (2) Existing supply that can't meet the demand date (but will still meet the negative days limit) > (3) On-hand > (4) New supply.
 ;Help text for pegging control in Master planning, Coverage Group and Item Coverage forms

 ;Label for pegging control in Master planning, Coverage Group and Item Coverage forms

ProdBatchExpirationDateForRawMaterialsValidationFeatureLabel=Validate expiration of raw materials against planned consumption date 
 ;The Label for ProdBatchExpirationDateForRawMaterialsValidationFeature.
ProdBatchExpirationDateForRawMaterialsValidationFeatureSummary=This feature changes how batch expiration dates are validated when reserving a batch of raw material to be used during production. When this feature is enabled, the batch expiration date is validated against the planned consumption date (the raw material date), as established on the production BOM line or batch order formula line. Previously, the batch expiration date was validated against the planned delivery date of the production or batch order. 
 ;The Summary for ProdBatchExpirationDateForRawMaterialsValidationFeature.

ProductionAndShopFloorJobIdentification=Unified job IDs
 ;Label for the  ProductionAndShopFloorJobId EDT
ProductionAndShopFloorJobIdNumberSeqCanGiveOverlappingNumbers=This number sequence code will result in job identifications that overlap across number sequences. To solve this, we recommend that you enable the "Unified number sequences for job IDs" feature in feature management. For more information, see https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2147232.
 ;Error message if number sequence for job identification of manufacturing execution jobs, indirect activities job and production order jobs do not match.
ProductionAndShopFloorJobIdNumberSeqFeatureLabel=Unified number sequence for job IDs
 ;Label for ProductionAndShopFloorJobIdNumberSeqFeature feature
ProductionAndShopFloorJobIdNumberSeqFeatureSummary=This feature provides a single, unified number sequence that generates job IDs for the Production control, Manufacturing execution, and Time and attendance modules. Previously, you were able to choose a different number sequence for each of these modules, which could result in conflicting job IDs if two or more of these sequences used an identical format. Such a conflict can cause data corruption. On enabling this feature, the existing "Job identification" number-sequence settings located on the parameters pages for each of these modules will be deprecated and a new "Unified job ID" field will be added. The "Unified job ID" field value is shared by all three modules, thus ensuring that they will all reference the same number sequence. Job IDs will therefore be unique across all three modules and the conflict will never occur.
 ;Summary for for ProductionAndShopFloorJobIdNumberSeqFeature feature
ProductionAndShopFloorJobIdNumberSeqReferenceHelpText=This number sequence generates unique job IDs for the works order scheduling, indirect activities, switch codes, project jobs, and so on.
 ;Reference help text for number sequence of production and shop floor job Id

 ;A caption for the production area functionality

 ;Entity exposes production cost comparison data.
ProductionCosting=Production costing
 ;Production costing field group.
ProductionCostOnlyCalcCoProductOnceFeatureSummary=This feature fixes a conflict that can sometimes occur when co-product prices are calculated by using multiple threads.\r\n It causes the system to make sure that each co-product price is calculated just once. The result of that calculation is then used as the input for all other calculations. If a pending price already exists, that price is used.
 ;Label for ProductionCostOnlyCalcCoProductOnceFeature summary.
ProductionCostOnlyCalculateCoProductOnceFeature=Optimisation of co-product pending price calculation
 ;Label for ProductionCostOnlyCalculateCoProductOnceFeature name.
ProductionCostOnlyCalculateCoProductOnceFeatureSummary=There is occasional incident that the price calculation of co-product is failed due to confliction update when price calcualtion is in multiple thread.\r\nThis feature is designed to solve this update confliction issue for co-product pending price calculation. When there are price calculation in multiple thread, system will only calculate the pending price of co-product one time and use it as the input in all other calculations. If there is pending price exist already, the existed pending price is used.
 ;Label for ProductionCostOnlyCalculateCoProductOnceFeature summary.

 ;Label for DaysAgo control on PurchParmCleanUp
PurchParmCleanUpDaysAgo_HelpText=Set the maximum age (in days) of records to keep each time the task runs. Older records will be deleted. This setting only applies when "Retain records based on age" is set to "Yes".
 ;Help text forPurchParmCleanUpDaysAgo
PurchParmCleanUpSetDaysAgo=Retain records based on age
 ;Label for SetDaysAgo control on PurchParmCleanUp
PurchParmCleanUpSetDaysAgo_HelpText=Set to "Yes" to enable the "Maximum age" setting, which establishes the maximum age of records to keep each time the task runs (ignores the "Created until" setting). Set to "No" to enable the "Created until" setting, which sets a specific date for the oldest records to keep (ignores the "Maximum age" setting). If you are scheduling this cleanup as a recurring task, then you should set this option to "Yes" because the age is always calculated relative to the date the task is run.
 ;Help text for PurchParmCleanUpSetDaysAgo

PurchReqConsolidateRequisitionsByAccountingDateFeature_Label=Consolidate multiple purchase requisitions into a single purchase order by accounting date
 ;Label for the PurchReqConsolidateRequisitionsByAccountingDateFeature feature
PurchReqConsolidateRequisitionsByAccountingDateFeature_Summary=This feature allows for the consolidation of multiple purchase requisitions into a single purchase order if the different purchase requisitions have different accounting dates. Purchase order creation and demand consolidation purchasing policy rule can be setup to drive the decision for grouping requisition lines by accounting date on purchase order level automatically. Warning! Purchase order consolidation by accounting date is not supported if budget control is enabled because the accounting date is used for budget reservations and encumbrance. Therefore, it should be retained during the transition from purchase requisition to purchase order.
 ;Summary for the PurchReqConsolidateRequisitionsByAccountingDateFeature feature

 ;An error message when system cannot find Key Vault key associated to the sealed bidding reply.

PurchRFQSealedBiddingFeatureLabel=Sealed bidding for RFQs
 ;Label for PurchRFQSealedBiddingFeature.
PurchRFQSealedBiddingFeatureSummary=This feature is not available for China and US Government clouds. Promote fair procurement practices by implementing sealed bidding on your requests for quotation (RFQs). When a supplier submits a bid for an RFQ case set for sealed bidding, the system automatically encrypts details such as prices and quantities for confidentiality until the bidding period expires. At the end of the bidding period, the purchasing agent can then open and evaluate all the bids at once. The feature lets you set some or all RFQ cases for sealed bidding, select an appropriate bidding period for each case and configure a dedicated Azure Key Vault for encrypting the submitted bids.
 ;Label for PurchRFQSealedBiddingFeature summary.
PurchRFQSealedBidEncryptionKeyActivationDayOffset=Encryption key activation day offset

PurchRFQSendEmailFeatureName=Request for quotation amendment and cancellation email framework options
 ;Label used for PurchRFQSendEmailFeature feature
PurchRFQSendEmailFeatureSummary=This feature gives you the option to send a RFQ amendment and RFQ cancellation emails using either SSRS report or email distributor framework. This feature adds new settings to both the "Amendment" and "Cancellation" group of fields of the "Request for quotation" tab in the Procurement and sourcing parameters. When this feature is enabled, the new "Send email using" options become available and can be used for determining the preferred way of sending emails. SSRS report is the default value. Selecting the SSRS report option means that an email is sent as part of generating the report using the SSRS report. This option should be used if only a few email recipients should receive the email or if the report should be delivered as an attachment to the email. Selecting the Email distributor option means that an email is sent using the email distributor framework. With the email distributor option, the email can be monitored in the Batch email sending status. This option should be used when emails are sent to many recipients. When using the email distributor option, the report cannot be sent as an attachment. Without this feature, the system always sends email using the rendering of the SSRS report.
 ;Label used for PurchRFQSendEmailFeature feature
PurchRFQSendEmailMethod_EmailDistributor_Label=Email distributor
 ;Label for EmailDistributor value of PurchRFQSendEmailMethod enum
PurchRFQSendEmailMethod_Help=Select the method that is used to send email.\n\t- SSRS Report: an email is sent as part of generating the report using the SSRS report. This option should be used if only a few email recipients should receive the email or if the report should be delivered as an attachment to the email.\n\t- Email distributor: an email is sent using the email distributor framework. With the email distributor option, the email can be monitored in the Batch email sending status. This option should be used when emails are sent to many recipients. When using the email distributor option, the report cannot be sent as an attachment.
 ;Label for PurchRFQSendEmailMethod enum help text

ReqSupplyAutomationFeatureDescription=Make-to-order supply automation enables you to do the following:\r\n- View the resource capacity load for a user-defined period, thereby enabling long-term evaluation of the capacity load.\r\n- Improve flexibility by controlling the delay tolerance (negative days) for each master plan.\r\n- Keep products available for last-minute orders and optimise usage of existing supply. This is achieved by using the latest possible supply to a demand, instead of using the first possible supply.\r\n- Keep component assignment flexible for works orders after firming, which enables the system to optimise for last-minute demand changes. In other words, limit marking to one level.\r\n- Control fulfillment policy for each sales order with defaulting from the customer setup.\r\n- Enhance intercompany information flow. Purchase orders are updated to include fields for mode of delivery, delivery terms, and external item number. This ensures that detailed demand information can flow to the supplying company.\r\n
 ;Feature description for make-to-order supply automation.

It establishes whether the system will respect the flushing principle defined for each BOM and formula line. Set this to "Yes" to only report the extra materials as consumed for lines set to use the "Finished" flushing principle. Set this to "No" to report extra materials as consumed for all lines, regardless of their flushing principle setting. This setting only applies when reporting as finished and doesn't affect items from the planned production run (non-over-produced items).

SalesCopyTotalDiscountSalesCreditNoteFeature_Label=Copy total discount group for sales credit note
 ;Label for SalesCopyTotalDiscountSalesCreditNoteFeature feature
SalesCopyTotalDiscountSalesCreditNoteFeature_Summary= This change will introduce the copying of the total discount group from a sales order header, when the header functions Create Credit Note is applied for a sales order and Find Sales Order is applied for a sales return order. Without this feature, the total discount group will be defaulted from the customer account, when the sales order or sales return order is created, and not automatically updated when using either of these header functions. When this feature is enabled, the total discount group is copied from the sales order related to the sales invoice used as source when applying the header function Create Credit Note or Find Sales Order. If no total discount group is found, then the total discount group defaulted from the customer account when the sales order or sales return order is created will not be updated. This change will have an impact on pricing in scenarios for sales orders of type sales order, where the calculation of total discount is set to take place upon posting. This policy is set in accounts receivables parameters for price. When the total discount calculation is set to take place upon posting, then the total discount percentage applied from the sales invoice will be recalculated based on the total discount group on the sales order of type sales order. In the case of more sales orders included in the sales invoice used as source for the function Create Credit Note, and the total discount group is different on these sales orders, then the total discount group applied will be the one related to the sales order for the invoice record selected in the Create Credit Note and Find Sales Order forms. In case where the sales order has been deleted after invoicing or no total discount group is found, then the total discount group defaulted from the customer account upon sales order or sales return order creation will not be changed.
 ;Summary for SalesCopyTotalDiscountSalesCreditNoteFeature feature

 ;Label used for SalesD365SalesMessageProcessorTabPage.
SalesDataEntityCalcLineNetAmountFeature_Label=Calculate line net amount on import
 ;Label for the SalesDataEntityCalcLineNetAmountFeature feature
SalesDataEntityCalcLineNetAmountFeature_Summary=This feature lets you control whether the system should recalculate line totals when you import data through the "Sales order lines", "Sales quotation lines", or "Return order lines" entity using OData or dual-write. It only has an effect when you also have trade agreement evaluation policies in place that restrict changes to the "Net amount" field for sales order lines, sales quotation lines, and/or return order lines. It adds a setting called "Calculate line net amount" to the "Sales ledger > Setup > Sales ledger parameters" page. When this setting is set to "Yes", the system will always recalculate line amounts when needed (thereby ignoring any trade agreement evaluation policy for the line net amount). When the setting is set to "No", the system will never automatically calculate the line net amount, even when incoming changes to the line price, quantity, and/or discount would imply that the line net amount should be recalculated. This feature is enabled by default and initially sets "Calculate line net amount" to "Yes". The "No" setting matches the system behaviour prior to version 10.0.23 and is provided chiefly to support legacy integration scenarios.
 ;Summary for the SalesDataEntityCalcLineNetAmountFeature feature
SalesDataEntityExportPolicyFeature_Label=Sales order referenced data export policy
 ;Label for the SalesDataEntityExportPolicyFeature feature
SalesDataEntityExportPolicyFeature_Summary=The feature enables a parameter under Sales ledger parameters/General/Data entity export setup: Skip referenced data during change tracking. When this parameter is enabled, changes to referenced data will not cause those orders (or lines) to be included in the next incremental export. The benefit of this is that incremental exports run more quickly.
 ;Summary for the SalesDataEntityExportPolicyFeature feature
SalesDataEntityExpPolicyFeature_Label=Sales referenced data export policy
 ;Label for the SalesDataEntityExpPolicyFeature feature
SalesDataEntityExpPolicyFeature_Summary=The feature enables following parameters under Sales ledger parameters > General > Data entity export setup: "Skip referenced data during change tracking" and "Skip sales quotation referenced data during change tracking". When these two parameters are enabled, changes to referenced data will not cause sales order or sales order lines, and sales quotation or quotation lines to be included in the next incremental export. The benefit of this is that incremental exports run quicker.
 ;Summary for the SalesDataEntityExpPolicyFeature feature

SalesMaxNumberSalesOrdersForPostingFeature_Summary=This feature lets you define the maximum number of sales orders that can be selected when posting confirmations, picking lists, delivery notes and invoices from the sales orders list page. It is enabled automatically. The feature adds a setting called "Max. number of sales orders for posting" to the "Sales ledger parameters" page. The new setting defaults to a value of 100. The feature helps improve the performance of the sales orders list page when a substantial number of sales orders are selected. It has no impact on the number of sales orders that can be processed by a periodic task.

SalesOrderArchiveAutomationFeature=(Preview) Archive sales orders to history tables using archive service
 ;Label for Sales order archive feature name.
SalesOrderArchiveAutomationFeatureSummary=Keeping a large volume of historical sales orders and lines in your day-to-day working environment not only results in increased storage costs, but also impacts system performance and usability. You can leverage the archival framework to perform rules-based archiving of historical sales orders and lines. The archived records are removed from your day-to-day working environment and stored in your Dataverse managed data lake, thereby improving system performance and lowering operating costs while keeping your historical sales records available as read-only data for when you need them. This feature performs the first step in the archival process, which is archiving from day-to-day transaction tables to history tables. Once archived to history tables, the data from the day-to-day transaction tables will be purged.
 ;Label for Sales order archive feature summary.
SalesOrderArchiveAutomationJobRequestCreatorDescription=Sales order archive automation job
 ;Label for sales order archive automation job request sent to archive service.

 ;Caption for criteria for sales order archive automation type.

SalesOrderDefaultFulfillmentPolicyHelpText=Shows the default fulfillment policy that applies if no 'Order fulfillment policy' is selected for this order. If this is blank, that means that no customer-specific or global default fulfillment policy is defined. The fulfillment policy controls the percentage of the total order price or quantity that must be physically reserved before you can release a sales order to the warehouse. If both the 'Order fulfillment policy' and 'Default fulfillment policy' are blank, then no fulfillment policy applies, but other restrictions might be in place that require reservations or other conditions to be met before the sales order can be released.

SalesOrderToPurchaseOrderLineDeletionPolicyFeature=Sales order to purchase order line deletion policy
 ;Label for SalesOrderToPurchaseOrderLineDeletionPolicyFeature feature
SalesOrderToPurchaseOrderLineDeletionPolicyFeature_Summary=This feature lets you control what will happen to a purchase order line that is referenced by a sales order line when a user manually deletes that sales order line. This feature does not affect direct delivery scenarios. You can set the system to delete a referenced purchase order line entirely, or to delete the reference only (thereby keeping the purchase order line but removing the marking). By default, the system will keep the purchase order line but remove the marking. Set this option using the new "Sales order line deletion policy" setting on the "Sales ledger parameters" page.
 ;Summary for SalesOrderToPurchaseOrderLineDeletionPolicyFeature feature

SalesParmCleanUpDataRetentionFeature_Label=Clean up sales update history based on age
 ;Label for the SalesParmCleanUpDataRetentionFeature feature
SalesParmCleanUpDataRetentionFeature_Summary=This feature lets you set the maximum age of records to keep when running the "Sales update history cleanup" periodic task. Older records will be deleted. This is useful for when you set the task to run periodically because the age is always calculated relative to the date the task is run. Without this feature, you can only set a specific date for the oldest records to keep.
 ;Summary for the SalesParmCleanUpDataRetentionFeature feature
SalesParmCleanUpDaysAgo=Maximum age
 ;Label for DaysAgo control on SalesParmCleanUp
SalesParmCleanUpDaysAgo_HelpText=Set the maximum age (in days) of records to keep each time the task runs. Older records will be deleted. This setting only applies when "Retain records based on age" is set to "Yes".
 ;Help text for SalesParmCleanUpDaysAgo
SalesParmCleanUpSetDaysAgo=Retain records based on age
 ;Label for SetDaysAgo control on SalesParmCleanUp
SalesParmCleanUpSetDaysAgo_HelpText=Set to "Yes" to enable the "Maximum age" setting, which establishes the maximum age of records to keep each time the task runs (ignores the "Created until" setting). Set to "No" to enable the "Created until" setting, which sets a specific date for the oldest records to keep (ignores the "Maximum age" setting). If you are scheduling this cleanup as a recurring task, then you should set this option to "Yes" because the age is always calculated relative to the date the task is run.
 ;Help text for SalesParmCleanUpSetDaysAgo

SalesRecalculateEstimatedCustomerBalanceForImportedSOFeatureLabel=Recalculate estimated customer balance
 ;Recalculate estimated customer balance feature label
SalesRecalculateEstimatedCustomerBalanceForImportedSOFeatureSummary=This feature lets you choose whether the system should automatically recalculate the estimated customer balance each time a sales order is created or updated using oData. When sales orders are created or updated using oData, the customer estimated amount used for credit limit check is not automatically updated. It is required to run the 'Recalculate credit limit batch job'. This feature introduces a parameter in Sales ledger>Setup>Sales ledger parameters>Credit rating 'Automatically recalculate estimated customer balance'. When the parameter is enabled, a totals calculation is automatically performed in sales order create and update oData scenarios to automatically update the customer estimated amount used for credit limit check.
 ;Recalculate estimated customer balance feature summary label
SalesReplaceAltItemDataFeature=Replace alternative item defaults on sales lines
 ;Label for the SalesReplaceAltItemDataFeature feature
SalesReplaceAltItemDataFeatureSummary=This feature adds a parameter called "Replace alternative item defaults on sales lines" to the "General" tab of the "Sales ledger parameters" page. When this parameter is set to "Yes", and alternative items must always be used, all item-dependent information (such as financial dimensions and units of measure) from the alternative item will replace the original item information on the sales order line. When set to "No", all the information from the original item will remain on the sales order line and no replacements will be made. When you first enable this feature, the parameter defaults to "Yes", which matches the way the system behaves without this feature.
 ;Summary for the SalesReplaceAltItemDataFeature feature

SalesTotalsCalculateBatchMultiThreadFeatureLabel=Calculate sales totals using multiple threads
 ;Label for SalesTotalsCalculateBatchMultiThreadFeature feature.
SalesTotalsCalculateBatchMultiThreadFeatureSummary=This feature helps improve system performance by enabling the system to use parallel processing when calculating sales totals in batch. The feature adds a new "Number of threads" field to the "Calculate sales totals" dialogue. If you choose to run the calculation in batch, you'll also be able to use this field to set the maximum number of threads. A value of zero or one uses a single thread, while values higher than 1 enable multithreading.
 ;Summary for SalesTotalsCalculateBatchMultiThreadFeature feature
SalesTotalsCalculated=Totals calculated
 ;Flag that indicates whether the totals have been calculated for sales orders and quotations.
SalesTotalsCalculateForOrders=Calculate totals for sales orders
 ;Calculate totals for sales orders
SalesTotalsCalculateForOrdersHelpText=Run the batch job to calculate totals for sales orders
 ;Help Text for SalesTotalsCalculateForOrders field
SalesTotalsCalculateForQuotations=Calculate totals for sales quotations
 ;Calculate totals for sales quotations
SalesTotalsCalculateForQuotationsHelpText=Run the batch job to calculate totals for sales quotations
 ;Help Text for SalesTotalsCalculateForQuotations field
SalesTotalsCalculateNumberOfThreadsHelpText=Set the maximum number of threads to use when running in batch. A value of zero or one uses a single thread, while values higher than 1 enable multithreading. If your sales totals calculations are taking too long, consider increasing this value. To allow more resources for other processes while calculating sales totals, reduce this value. The actual maximum number of used threads will never exceed the maximum batch threads configured for your system. The orders and quotations selected for the calculation will be evenly distributed between the threads.
 ;Help Text for SalesTotalsCalculateNumThreads field

 ;The label of StdCostRevaluationRelatedVoucherFeatureLabel
StdCostRevaluationRelatedVoucherFeatureSummary=On making an stock financial posting (such as a sales order invoice or stock transaction), this feature causes the system to create a separate voucher for any related standard cost rounding revaluations, and to attach it to the financial posting voucher as a related voucher. Without this feature, the system records standard cost rounding revaluations on the same voucher posting, which can sometimes result in conflicting date information because the revaluations use the session or system date, while financial postings use the posting date.
 ;The label of StdCostRevaluationRelatedVoucherFeatureSummary

Summary_EcoResProductBarcodeAssociationFeature=Turn this feature on to be able to do updates or deletes as well as use change tracking for item - barcode associations. You will be able to do this by using the new entity named item - barcode associations.\r\n\r\nIts entity key is AssociationID, which creates the association between the barcode and the product. For having this key, the new table InventitemBarcodeAssociation will be populated for existing item-barcode data when you turn the feature on. Note the population of the table will be a batch job and that if your barcode table has a considerable amount of records, it could take a considerable time to run the batch job. Therefore, we recommend that you plan enabling the feature (thus the batch job) in a time that fits your business needs.
 ;Summary for the EcoResProductBarcodeAssociationFeature feature.
Summary_EcoResProductParametersCompanyNumSeqFeature=Enable the setup of company specific number sequences in Product information management parameters form, having tabs Number sequences for company specific and Shared number sequences for number sequences common across companies.
 ;Summary for the EcoResProductParametersCompanyNumSeqFeature feature
Summary_EcoResProductTemplateDefaultDimensionMergeFeature=Enable this feature to use the different financial dimensions (Business unit, Cost centre, Department, Item group, and Project) as separate when applying a template. When the template is applied and contains one or more of the financial dimensions, instead of overwriting all the financial dimensions specified on the item, the dimensions will be treated separately. In other words, if a given financial dimension (e.g. Cost centre) is specified on the item, its value for the specific financial dimension will be kept when applying the template that has a blank value for the financial dimension. And if the item's value for the dimension is blank or specified, and the item template defaults a value, then the value from the template will be defaulted on the item.
 ;Summary for the EcoResProductTemplateDefaultDimensionMergeFeature feature.
Summary_EcoResProductVariantItemSalesTaxGroupFeature=With this feature it is possible to set up a specific item VAT group for a released product variant. The specific item VAT group for a released product variant can be set up both for sales and procurement. \r\nIf a specific item VAT group is set up for a released product variant for sales, then this item VAT group is used as default when creating a sales quotation and sales order line. \r\nSimilarly for purchase order, purchase requisition, and purchase requisition, if a specific item VAT group is set up for a released product variant for purchase, then this is used as default.\r\nIf no specific item VAT group is set up for a released product variant, then the item VAT group setup for the product is used as default.
 ;Summary for the EcoResProductVariantItemSalesTaxGroupFeature feature.

 ;Label for the IntercompanyDirectDeliveryOrderPromisingDatesFeature feature.
UpdateRequestedReceiptDateFeatureSummary=This feature lets you control what will happen to sales and purch date field values within intercompany direct delivery scenario. You can set the system to skip requested dates updating or to update them. In the first case the requested dates will represent what the customer has set up. Otherwise the requested dates, when using delivery date control, only initially represent what the customer has requested. Delivery date control, when different from None, will overrule what has initially been requested. It is a design limitation since the introduction of delivery date control. You can manage this option using the new "Update Requested receipt date with Confirmed date" setting on the intercompany supplier or customer settings. \r\nIf the feature is disable, system will overwrite requested receipt date on original sales order based on delivery date control rule. But requested shipping date will remain as it is. 
 ;Summary for the IntercompanyDirectDeliveryOrderPromisingDatesFeature feature.

WarningInventTransArchivingJob=We recommend running stock transactions archiving outside of business hours. Also If you continue the archiving job, the stock transactions in this period will be archived, the on-hand report, stock value report, stock ageing report, stock closing and cancel, and forecast from planning etc will be impacted, please consider to select ledger period that stock transactions in this period won't be processed any more. Are you sure you want to continue?
 ;Label for warning inventory transactions archiving job.
WarningInventTransArchivingJobCheck=We recommend running stock transactions archiving outside of business hours. Note that this process cannot be reversed once it has been finished. Also If you continue the archiving job, the stock transactions in this period will be archived, the on-hand report, stock value report, stock ageing report, stock closing and cancel, and forecast from planning etc will be impacted, please consider to select ledger period that stock transactions in this period won't be processed any more. Are you sure you want to continue?
 ;Label for warning inventory transactions archiving job during creation.
WarningInventTransArchivingJobCheckV2=We recommend running stock transaction consolidation outside of business hours. Note that this process cannot be reversed once it has been finished. Also If you continue the job, the stock transactions in this period will be consolidated, the on-hand report, stock value report, stock ageing report, stock closing and cancel, and forecast from planning etc will be impacted, please consider to select ledger period that stock transactions in this period won't be processed any more. Are you sure you want to continue?

In order to display these fields, the line must not be missing any of the values for stock dimensions between the top of the reservation hierarchy and the last dimension with a shown value.
